content.user_title: Create scientific research posters in LaTeX
content.value_statement: Research posters are essential for scientific communication at conferences. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for creating professional research posters using LaTeX packages like beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter. Generate publication-quality posters with proper layout, typography, and visual hierarchy.
actual_capabilities: Create research posters using beamerposter, tikzposter, or baposter packages
Apply layout principles including multi-column grids and visual hierarchy
Design with proper typography for poster readability
Integrate figures, tables, equations, and citations in poster format
Optimize poster output for printing and digital display
Review PDF quality including font embedding and image resolution
limitations: Requires LaTeX distribution installation (TeX Live, MiKTeX)
Does not generate AI images or diagrams directly
User must provide their own research content and figures
Templates serve as starting points requiring customization

use_cases.title: Conference Poster Creation
use_cases.description: Prepare professional research posters for academic conferences with proper formatting and layout.

use_cases.title: Scientific Communication
use_cases.description: Create publication-quality posters for presenting research findings at symposiums and university events.

use_cases.title: Template Standardization
use_cases.description: Develop consistent poster templates for group members with institutional branding and guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Poster Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a research poster using LaTeX. I need a template for a [size: A0/A1/36x48] [orientation: portrait/landscape] poster for a [field] conference. Include sections for introduction, methods, results, and conclusions.

prompt_templates.title: Package Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Which LaTeX poster package should I use for [specific use case: modern colorful design/traditional academic style/structured multi-column layout]? Compare beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter with their advantages.

prompt_templates.title: Design Customization
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me customize my poster with specific [color scheme] and [font selection]. I want to match my institution's branding and ensure color-blind accessibility. What color palettes and font sizes work best?

prompt_templates.title: Quality Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my generated poster PDF for quality. Check page dimensions, font embedding, image resolution, and identify any issues that might affect printing. Provide a checklist for final review.

output_examples.input: Create a 3-column A0 portrait research poster template for a machine learning conference using baposter.
output: Complete baposter LaTeX template with 3-column layout
Configuration for A0 paper size (2384x3370 points)
Placeholder sections: Introduction, Methods, Results, Conclusions
Code snippets for compiling with pdflatex

output_examples.input: What font sizes should I use for different poster elements?
output: Body text: 24-36pt minimum for 4-6 foot viewing
Use sans-serif fonts (Arial, Helvetica) for clarity

output_examples.input: How do I ensure my poster prints correctly? What should I check before submission?
output: Verify page size matches conference requirements exactly
Check all fonts are embedded using pdffonts command
Confirm images are 300 DPI minimum for print quality
Test color contrast meets WCAG accessibility standards
Reduce file size if over 50MB for email submission

best_practices: Use high-contrast, color-blind friendly color schemes and test with accessibility checkers
Include QR codes linking to papers, code, and supplementary materials
Review at 25% scale printout to simulate viewing from typical conference distance
anti_patterns: Overcrowding with text - limit to 300-800 words total for scannability
Using red-green color combinations that are inaccessible to color-blind viewers
Skipping PDF quality checks - always verify font embedding and image resolution before printing

faq.question: Which LaTeX poster package should I choose?
faq.answer: Choose beamerposter for Beamer familiarity, tikzposter for modern designs, or baposter for structured layouts.

faq.question: What is the minimum font size for poster body text?
faq.answer: Use minimum 24pt body text for readability from 4-6 feet. Title should be 72-120pt.

faq.question: What poster sizes are supported?
faq.answer: Standard sizes include A0 (841x1189mm), A1 (594x841mm), and 36x48 inches for North American conferences.

faq.question: How do I add QR codes to my poster?
faq.answer: Use \usepackage{qrcode} and \qrcode[height=2cm]{https://your-link} to include scannable QR codes.

faq.question: How do I check if fonts are embedded in my PDF?
faq.answer: Run pdffonts poster.pdf and verify all fonts show 'yes' in the embedded column.

faq.question: What image resolution do I need?
faq.answer: Use minimum 300 DPI at final print size. For A0 width (33.1 inches), aim for at least 9930 pixels.
